title: [BUG] - entry point name must have .sh or .py suffix when using --backend databricks
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: yes.  
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:  OSx Mojave 10.14.5
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: via pip 19.2.3
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.3.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.6
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: NA
- **Exact command to reproduce**:  see below.

### Describe the problem


This command works for entry point `e_train.py`:
```bash
mlflow run ./ -e e_train.py --backend databricks --backend-config databricks_backend.json
```
with the following MLProject
```yaml
name: myproject
conda_env: conda.yaml
entry_points:
  e_train.py:
    command: "python mystuff/train.py"
```

However, this does not for entry point named `train`.  The entry point cannot be found (see screenshot and error below).

```bash
mlflow run ./ -e train --backend databricks --backend-config databricks_backend.json
```
Only change is the name of the entry point (`e_train.py` vs `train`).
```yaml
name: myproject
conda_env: conda.yaml
entry_points:
  train:
    command: "python mystuff/train.py"
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44206483/67720134-6cf34580-f990-11e9-962f-d121fa55f5e5.png)

```
=== Could not find train among entry points [] or interpret train as a runnable script. Supported script file extensions: ['.py', '.sh'] ===
```

It looks like something about `--backend databricks` requires that the entry point be named with `.py` or `.sh` suffix (a weird pattern).... but not when running `mlflow run` locally.


#### Possible related GH issues

These have same error, but appears to be for different reasons.  

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1094
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1762
